Detailed Description

A system that adds support steering behaviours to the objects.

Member Function Documentation

◆ Arrive()

void tnt::doo::steering_sys::Arrive ( object const &  id,
Vector const &  target 
) const
noexcept

Direct the given object towards target with a speed that decreases as distance decreases.

Parameters
idThe object to make seek towards target.
targetThe position where obj will be directed to.

◆ Evade()

void tnt::doo::steering_sys::Evade ( object const &  id,
object const &  target 
) const
noexcept

Move object id away from target. Useful when target is supposed to be moving.

Parameters
idThe object to flee away from target.
targetThe object which obj will avoid.
Note
Use Flee if target is not supposed to be moving.
See also
tnt::steer::Flee

◆ Flee()

void tnt::doo::steering_sys::Flee ( object const &  id,
Vector const &  target 
) const
noexcept

Move object id away from target.

Parameters
idThe id of the moving object.
targetThe position that the object will avoid.
Note
Use RangedFlee if you want obj to stay at a certain distance away from target.
Use Evade if target is supposed to be moving. It gives more "natural" results.
See also
RangedFlee
Evade

◆ Pursuit()

void tnt::doo::steering_sys::Pursuit ( object const &  id,
object const &  target 
) const
noexcept

Direct the first object towards target. Useful when target is supposed to be moving.

Parameters
idThe object to make seek towards target.
targetThe object which obj will follow.
Note
Use Seek if target is not supposed to be moving.
See also
Seek

◆ RangedFlee()

void tnt::doo::steering_sys::RangedFlee ( object const &  id,
Vector const &  target,
float  range 
) const
noexcept

Move object id away from target if it is close enough.

Parameters
idThe id of the moving object.
targetThe center of the circular area to be avoided.
rangeThe minimum distance that the object and the target can have.
See also
Flee
Evade

Vector const &  target 
) const
noexcept

Move object id towards target.

Parameters
idThe id of the moving object.
targetThe desired position in global coordinates.
Note
Use Pursuit if target is supposed to be moving. It gives more "natural" results.
